item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! My name is Amit Kumar-Hermosillo. I am a computer engineering student at Olin College. Most recently, I’ve worked as a software development engineer intern at Amazon, overhauling the full stack for the primary inventory compliance management tool used to search and suppress defective inventories, making the UI easier to use and more robust to inadvertent error and adding new action types that mitigate prior causes of or inventory leakage.

item.title: Billboard Hot 100 Analysis

item.title: CAN Dashboard
item.description: I built a Qt-based CAN Dashboard for Olin’s Formula SAE Team with a heavy focus on usability, maintainability, and expandability. The dashboard displaying the data from the first day we spun our car’s wheels! Features The dashboard allows engineers to quickly and easily get live CAN information to debug our vehicle systems. It is extremely flexible, and can be used at any level, from just monitoring the messages from a single board to those from a particular enclosure or module to the entire car all at once.

item.title: NBA Predction ML Model
item.description: I built a machine learning model trained on historical data that uses teams’ performances over their last 10 games to predict their match results with 72% accuracy. The Data To train my model, I scraped every single NBA match over the last 10 years (data from basketball-reference.com), along with every team’s monthly set of advanced statistics for that same time period (data from nba.com). The data was scraped using BeautifulSoup, Selenium, and Pandas.
